message: I'd rather it just happen and allow me to undo, or ask me if I want confirmations again.
Yeah, I agree that'd be a nice feature. It was actually being talked about a few days ago https://convore.com/feedback/undo-instead-of-confirmation/
I'm curious why you wouldn't want to have confirmation before doing such a large operation like marking all as read?
^ @ericflo chimed in on that mentioning that it's the direction in which they're headed, but the it just isn't setup in a way to allow that just yet.
(but also the ability / option to just disable confirmation dialogs entirely)
Also, I think a window.alert() is annoying because it interferes with focus. A modal dialog using some markup & a button element would be preferred, to me
@zerok I agree. It just breaks with the style and focus. It'd also be great if it was something optional.
I like the gmail style undo.

Personally I don't mind having to confirm it, but alert() kind of breaks the style otherwise implemented in actions here. I'd personally prefer a small box showing up right next to the clicked button (or even replace it) which allows to confirm the action.
